attributes.description: This is a look at the path a FIJI water bottle goes through to becoming a commodity in the United States.
attributes.title: FIJI Water
Manufacturing of plastic resin
attributes.description: The first part of production. Amcor Plastics creates the plastic resin used to make the shape of the FIJI water bottles.

attributes.title: Pumping System
attributes.description: Here the water from the Fiji aquifers is pumped into the bottles with state of the art machinery that prevents the water from ever touching above ground oxygen. After this action is complete. The bottles are ready for departure and are then sent back to San Francisco for American distribution.

attributes.title: Distribution
attributes.description: Here, the FIJI water bottles are imported and are distributed to companies across the United States.

attributes.title: Labels
attributes.description: Here the water bottles have their labels manufactured. These labels display all nutritional and environmental information about the production that went into a FIJI water bottle.

attributes.title: Bottle caps
attributes.description: In Taiwan, the bottle caps of FIJI water bottles are all manufactured here. The caps are made of the same plastic resin used to create the shape of the bottle. These caps are then shipped to Fiji to finish the completion of the bottles.

attributes.title: Manufacturing of plastic resin to Pumping System
Bottle caps installed  to Pumping System
